short_effect: Transfers 1/4 of the user's max HP into a doll, protecting the user from further damage or status changes until it breaks.
effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max [HP]{mechanic} into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the [field]{mechanic}, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the [HP]{mechanic} cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its [HP]{mechanic} reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from [confusion]{mechanic} or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's [HP]{mechanic} still do so; the doll's [HP]{mechanic} does not influence any move.

The doll will block [major status effect]{mechanic}s, [confusion]{mechanic}, and [flinch]{mechanic}ing.  The effects of [Smellingsalt]{move} and [Wake-up Slap]{move} do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate [major status effect]{mechanic}.  Multi-turn trapping moves like [Wrap]{move} will hit the doll for their [regular damage]{mechanic}, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., [Avalanche]{move}, [Counter]{move}, or a [Rowap Berry]{item}.  [Magic Coat]{move} still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like [Absorb]{move} are healed as normal.

It will also block [Acupressure]{move}, [Block]{move}, the curse effect of [Curse]{move}, [Dream Eater]{move}, [Embargo]{move}, [Flatter]{move}, [Gastro Acid]{move}, [Grudge]{move}, [Heal Block]{move}, [Leech Seed]{move}, [Lock-On]{move}, [Mean Look]{move}, [Mimic]{move}, [Mind Reader]{move}, [Nightmare]{move}, [Pain Split]{move}, [Psycho Shift]{move}, [Spider Web]{move}, [Sketch]{move}, [Swagger]{move}, [Switcheroo]{move}, [Trick]{move}, [Worry Seed]{move}, and [Yawn]{move}.  A Pokémon affected by [Yawn]{move} before summoning the doll will still fall to [sleep]{mechanic}.

The doll blocks [Intimidate]{ability}, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for [HP]{mechanic} (such as [Volt Absorb]{ability} absorbing [Thunder Wave]{move}), such moves will not be blocked.

[Life Orb]{item} and berries that cause [confusion]{mechanic} still work as normal, but their respective [HP]{mechanic} loss and [confusion]{mechanic} are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the [field]{mechanic}, such as by [Pursuit]{move} or [Spikes]{move}; however, the doll will block the [poison]{mechanic} effect of [Toxic Spikes]{move}.

The doll is passed on by [Baton Pass]{move}.  It keeps its existing [HP]{mechanic}, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If the target hasn't used a move since entering the [field]{mechanic}, if it tried to use a move this turn and [failed]{mechanic},  if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, or if it already has a move disabled, this move will fail.

If the target is prevented from using the selected move by some other effect, [Struggle]{move} will be used instead.  This effect ends if the selected move runs out of [PP]{mechanic}.

If the target hasn't used a move since entering the [field]{mechanic}, if it tried to use a move this turn and [failed]{mechanic}, if it does not know the selected move, or if the selected move has 0 [PP]{mechanic} remaining, this move will fail.  If the target's last used move was [Encore]{move}, [Mimic]{move}, [Mirror Move]{move}, [Sketch]{move}, [Struggle]{move}, or [Transform]{move}, this move will fail.

One-hit KO moves are also guaranteed to hit, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  This effect also allows the user to hit Pokémon that are off the field due to moves such as [Dig]{move} or [Fly]{move}.

If the target uses [Detect]{move} or [Protect]{move} while under the effect of this move, the user is not guaranteed to hit, but has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

effect:
Only usable if the user is [sleep]{mechanic}ing.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 [PP]{mechanic}.

This move will not select [Assist]{move}, [Bide]{move}, [Bounce]{move}, [Chatter]{move}, [Copycat]{move}, [Dig]{move}, [Dive]{move}, [Fly]{move}, [Focus Punch]{move}, [freefall]{move}, [Me First]{move}, [Metronome]{move}, [Mirror Move]{move}, [Shadow Force]{move}, [Skull Bash]{move}, [Sky Attack]{move}, [Sleep Talk]{move}, [SolarBeam]{move}, [Razor Wind]{move}, or [Uproar]{move}.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of [Blast Burn]{move}, [Frenzy Plant]{move}, [Giga Impact]{move}, [Hydro Cannon]{move}, [Hyper Beam]{move}, [Roar of Time]{move}, or [Rock Wrecker]{move}—and the user is still [sleep]{mechanic}ing next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another [PP]{mechanic} for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by [Mirror Move]{move}, nor selected by [Assist]{move}, [Metronome]{move}, or [Sleep Talk]{move}.
